SEARCH
Module webfx.stack.com.bus
Package dev.webfx.stack.com.bus

Interface BusHook

All Known Implementing Classes:
BusHookProxy
public interface BusHook
A hook that you can use to receive various events on the Bus.
Author:
田传武 (aka Larry Tin) - author of Goodow realtime-channel project, Bruno Salmon - fork, refactor & update for the webfx project Original Goodow class

  • Method Details

    • handleOpened

      default void handleOpened()
      Called when the bus is opened

    • handlePostClose

      default void handlePostClose()
      Called when the bus is closed

    • handlePreClose

      default boolean handlePreClose()
      Called before close the bus
      Returns:
      true to close the bus, false to reject it

    • handlePreRegister

      default boolean handlePreRegister(String address, dev.webfx.platform.async.Handler<? extends Message> handler)
      Called before register a handler
      Parameters:
      address - The address
      handler - The handler
      Returns:
      true to let the registration occur, false otherwise

    • handleReceiveMessage

      default boolean handleReceiveMessage(Message<?> message)
      Called when a message is received
      Parameters:
      message - The message
      Returns:
      true To allow the message to deliver, false otherwise

    • handleSendOrPub

      default <T> boolean handleSendOrPub(boolean send, String address, Object msg, DeliveryOptions options, dev.webfx.platform.async.Handler<dev.webfx.platform.async.AsyncResult<Message<T>>> replyHandler)
      Called when sending or publishing on the bus
      Parameters:
      send - if true it's a send else it's a publish
      address - The address the message is being sent/published to
      msg - The message
      replyHandler - Reply handler will be called when any reply from the recipient is received
      Returns:
      true To allow the send/publish to occur, false otherwise

    • handleUnregister

      default boolean handleUnregister(String address)
      Called when unregistering a handler
      Parameters:
      address - The address
      Returns:
      true to let the unregistration occur, false otherwise
